info.title: Calendly
info.description: Calendly's connector empowers you to automate scheduled events, boosting productivity and optimizing efficiency through automated workflows.

created_at.description: The moment when the webhook was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").

created_by.description: A reference to the user who created the webhook subscription.

event.description: The event that caused the webhook to fire.

cancel_url.description: Link to cancelling the event for the invitee.

created_at.description: The moment when the event was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").

first_name.description: The first name of the invitee who booked the event when the event type is configured to use separate fields for first name and last name. Null when event type is configured to use a single field for name.

last_name.description: The last name of the invitee who booked the event when the event type is configured to use separate fields for first name and last name. Null when event type is configured to use a single field for name.

new_invitee.description: Link to new invitee, after reschedule.

old_invitee.description: Reference to old Invitee instance that got rescheduled.

question.description: A question on the invitee's booking form.

answer.description: The invitee's answer to the question.

position.description: The position of the question in relation to others on the booking form.

questions_and_answers.description: A collection of the invitee's responses to questions on the event booking confirmation form.
questions_and_answers.x-ms-summary: A collection of the invitee's responses to questions on the event booking confirmation form

reschedule_url.description: Link to rescheduling the event for the invitee.

utm_campaign.description: The UTM parameter used to track a campaign.

utm_source.description: The UTM parameter that identifies the source (platform where the traffic originates).

utm_medium.description: The UTM parameter that identifies the type of input (e.g. Cost Per Click (CPC), social media, affiliate or QR code).

utm_term.description: The UTM parameter used to track keyword.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the invitee.

routing_form_submission.description: Reference to a routing form submission that redirected the invitee to a booking page.

payload.description: An individual who has been invited to meet with a Calendly member.

post.description: Create a Webhook Subscription for an Organization that is triggered when an event is scheduled or canceled.

created_at.description: The moment when the webhook was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").

created_by.description: A reference to the user who created the webhook subscription.

event.description: The event that caused the webhook to fire.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the routing form submission.
uri.title: Routing Form Submission URI

routing_form.description: The URI of the routing form that's associated with the submission.
routing_form.title: Routing Form URI

question_uuid.description: Unique identifier for the routing form question.
question_uuid.title: Question UUID

answer.description: Answer provided by the respondent when the form was submitted.
answer.title: Answer

utm_campaign.description: The UTM parameter used to track a campaign.

utm_source.description: The UTM parameter that identifies the source (platform where the traffic originates).

utm_medium.description: The UTM parameter that identifies the type of input (e.g. Cost Per Click (CPC), social media, affiliate or QR code).

utm_term.description: The UTM parameter used to track keyword.

type.description: Indicates if the routing form submission resulted in a custom message, event type, or external URL.
type.title: Result Type

submitter.description: The reference to the Invitee resource when routing form submission results in a scheduled meeting.
submitter.title: Submitter URI

submitter_type.description: Type of the respondent resource that submitted the form and scheduled a meeting.
submitter_type.title: Submitter Type

created_at.description: The moment the routing form was submitted.
created_at.title: Routing Form Submission Created At

updated_at.description: The moment when the routing form submission was last updated.
updated_at.title: Routing Form Submission Updated At

post.description: Create a Webhook Subscription for an Organization that is triggered when a routing form is submitted.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the webhook subscription being deleted

count.description: The number of rows to return.
count.title: Pagination Count

next_page.description: URI to return the next page of an ordered list ("null" indicates no additional results are available).
next_page.title: Next Page URI

previous_page.description: URI to return the previous page of an ordered list ("null" indicates no additional results are available).
previous_page.title: Previous Page URI

next_page_token.description: Token to return the next page of an ordered list ("null" indicates no additional results are available).
next_page_token.title: Next Page Token

previous_page_token.description: Token to return the previous page of an ordered list ("null" indicates no additional results are available).
previous_page_token.title: Previous Page Token

get.description: Returns all Event Types associated with your organization.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Return only active event types if true, only inactive if false, or all event types if this parameter is omitted.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of rows to return.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: View available personal, team, and organization event types associated with the organization's URI.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to pass to get the next or previous portion of the collection.

parameters.name: admin_managed
parameters.description: Return only admin managed event types if true, exclude admin managed event types if false, or include all event types if this parameter is omitted.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the no show
uri.title: No Show URI

invitee.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the associated Invitee
invitee.title: Invitee URI

created_at.description: The moment when the no show was created
created_at.title: Created At

post.description: Marks an Invitee as a No Show.

invitee.description: URI of the invitee who is being marked as No Show for a scheduled event
invitee.title: Invitee URI

get.description: Returns information about a specified Event Type.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the Event Type being requested

delete.description: Undoes marking an Invitee as a No Show

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the invitee whose No Show record is being removed

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the resource.
uri.title: Event URI

status.description: Indicates if the event is "active" or "canceled".
status.title: Event Status

start_time.description: The moment the event was scheduled to start in UTC time (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").
start_time.title: Event Start Time

end_time.description: The moment the event was scheduled to end in UTC time (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")
end_time.title: Event End Time

event_type.description: The event type associated with this event
event_type.title: Event Type URI

total.description: Total invitees for an event, including invitees that have canceled
total.title: Total Invitees

active.description: Total invitees for an event that have not canceled.
active.title: Total Active Invitees

limit.description: Maximum number of active invitees that can book the event.
limit.title: Event Max Invitees

created_at.description: The moment when the event was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")
created_at.title: Event Created At

updated_at.description: The moment when the event was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z")
updated_at.title: Event Updated At

user.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the user.

event_guests.description: Additional people added to an event by an invitee

Cancellation.description: Provides data pertaining to the cancellation of the Event

canceled_by.description: Name of the person whom canceled.
canceled_by.title: Canceled By

canceler_type.description: Indicates whether the event was canceled by the "Host" or "Invitee".
canceler_type.title: Canceler Type

Guest.description: An individual whom an invitee has invited to be a guest attendee to an event

email.description: The email of the event guest.
email.title: Event Guest Email

created_at.description: Time that the event guest was created.
created_at.title: Event Guest Created At

updated_at.description: Time that the event guest was last updated.
updated_at.title: Event Guest Updated At

Location.description: The polymorphic base type for an event location that Calendly supports

status.description: This field only applies to zoom_conference, webex_conference, google_conference, gotomeeting, and microsoft_teams_conference location types.
status.title: Web Conference Status

join_url.description: This field only applies to zoom_conference, webex_conference, google_conference, gotomeeting, and microsoft_teams_conference location types.
join_url.title: Web Conference Meeting URL

location.description: This field only applies to outbound_call, inbound_call, physical, ask_invitee, and custom location types.
location.title: Event Location

LegacyCalendarEvent.description: Information about the calendar event from the calendar provider.

kind.description: Indicates the calendar provider the event belongs to.
kind.title: Calendly Event Kind

external_id.description: The id provided from the calendar provider for this calendar event.
external_id.title: External Calendar Event Id

currency.description: The currency format that the payment is in.

successful.description: Indicates whether the payment was successfully processed.

NoShow.description: Provides data pertaining to the associated no show for the Invitee.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the no show

created_at.description: The moment when the no show was created.

uri.description: Canonical reference (unique identifier) for the event type.
uri.title: Event Type URI

name.description: The event type name (in human-readable format).
name.title: Event Type Name

active.description: Indicates if the event is active or not.
active.title: Active

booking_method.description: Indicates if the event type is for a poll or an instant booking.
booking_method.title: Booking Method

slug.description: The portion of the event type's URL that identifies a specific web page (in a human-readable format).
slug.title: Slug

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the userâ€™s scheduling site where invitees book this event type.
scheduling_url.title: Scheduling URL

duration.description: The length of sessions booked with this event type.
duration.title: Duration

kind.description: Indicates if the event type is "solo" (belongs to an individual user) or "group".
kind.title: Kind

pooling_type.description: Indicates if the event type is "round robin" (alternates between hosts) or "collective" (invitees pick a time when all participants are available) or "null" (the event type doesnâ€™t consider the availability of a group participants).
pooling_type.title: Pooling Type

type.description: Indicates if the event type is "AdhocEventType" (ad hoc event) or "StandardEventType" (standard event type).
type.title: Type

color.description: The hexadecimal color value of the event type's scheduling page.
color.title: Color

created_at.description: The moment the event type was created (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").
created_at.title: Created At

updated_at.description: The moment the event type was last updated (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").
updated_at.title: Updated At

internal_note.description: Contents of a note that may be associated with the event type.
internal_note.title: Internal Note

description_plain.description: The event type's description (in non formatted text).
description_plain.title: Description (Plain)

description_html.description: The event type's description (formatted with HTML).
description_html.title: Description (HTML)

type.description: Indicates if the profile belongs to a "user" (individual) or "team".
type.title: Profile Type

name.description: Human-readable name for the profile of the user that's associated with the event type.
name.title: Profile Name

owner.description: The unique reference to the user associated with the profile.
owner.title: Profile Owner URI

secret.description: Indicates if the event type is hidden on the owner's main scheduling page.
secret.title: Secret

deleted_at.description: The moment the event type was deleted (e.g. "2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z").
deleted_at.title: Deleted At

admin_managed.description: Indicates if this event type is managed by an organization admin.
admin_managed.title: Admin Managed

Reconfirmation.description: Assuming reconfirmation is enabled for the event type, when reconfirmation is requested this object is present with a `created_at` that reflects when the reconfirmation notification was sent. Once the invitee has reconfirmed the `confirmed_at` attribute will change from `null` to a timestamp that reflects when they took action.

confirmed_at.description: When the Invitee confirmed their attendance.
